greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of solid standard Young tableaux of shape [[(n-k)*k,k],[n-k]]; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
S. B. Ekhad, D. Zeilberger, Computational and Theoretical Challenges on Counting Solid Standard Young Tableaux, arXiv:1202.6229v1 [math.CO], 2012
maple: b:= proc(x, y, z) option remember; `if`(z<y, b(x, z, y),
T:= (n, k)-> `if`(k=0 xor k=n, 0, b((n-k)*k, k, n-k)):
mathematica: b[x_, y_, z_] := b[x, y, z] = If[z<y, b[x, z, y], If[Union[{x, y, z}] == {0}, 1, If[x>y && x>z, b[x-1, y, z], 0] + If[y>0, b[x, y-1, z], 0] + If[z>0, b[x, y, z-1], 0]]]; T[n_, k_] := If[k == 0 || k == n, 0, b[(n-k)*k, k, n-k]]; T[0, 0] = 1; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 19 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Central elements of rows give A215123.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 03 2012
